nodes.name: Worst Day Ever
nodes.description:
Just when I thought I had a real chance to impress the Chief Thief and join the Thieves' Guild, I get caught. Not only do I get caught, but I get sent to school. Not only did I get sent to school, but I have to deal with jerks like Mr. Terk.

I'll lose my chance to become a Thief if I don't find a way out of this castle soon. I still got the Lucky Coin - now I only need to find some way to show it to the Chief Thief.

nodes.text: You know what you are, Conner? A slacker. I don't know why I had to be pulled from my breakfast to deal with the likes of you. You'll be out of here before the month is out... mark my words.

options.text: Answer Politely

nodes.text: I'm sorry that I interrupted your breakfast, sir.
As well you should be. I'm a very important person here. I should not have to waste my time with the likes of you.

options.text: Answer Firmly

nodes.text: My name is O'Conner, Shawn O'Conner. I wrote it down for you on that paper you had me fill out, Mr. Terk.
I'm aware of what you wrote, Conner. That's 5 demerits for talking back to me. One hundred demerits and you will be kicked out of here. You are already on your way.

options.text: Answer Snarkily

nodes.text: I'll try not to disappoint you.
That's 10 demerits for talking back to me. One hundred demerits and you will be kicked out of here. You are already on your way.
This is the Hero University. We take the best of the best and turn them into upstanding, outstanding people who make a difference in the world around them.
The only difference you'll ever make around you is an unnoticeable rise in the crime rate until you get caught and sent to prison for the rest of your life.
You are a waste of my time and the resources of this school.
Let's see if you have any skill or redeemable quality at all. Take this aptitude test.

nodes.message: If Shawn improves Fitness via the test, make sure he starts the game with full stamina.

nodes.text: The only skill in which you show any high degree of competence is your quick reflexes. Clearly, they aren't quick enough or you wouldn't have gotten caught.
You did surprisingly well on the test. It's clear that you are already a master of cheating and BS.
The test shows that you are physically fit. You could be working as a longshoreman or a farmer rather than wasting my time here.
Hmph... you have some magic talent. What a waste...
You are clever... perhaps too clever. Just not clever enough.
Hmmm... you have some leadership skills. Don't you dare try to manipulate people around here - I'll be watching you.
You demonstrate a very lackadaisical attitude in your answers here. You are clearly a slacker.
Just as I suspected: you aren't skilled enough to be a Warrior. You aren't smart or Magical enough to be a Wizard. You aren't good enough to be a Paladin. No discernible musical or acting talent.
There's only one class we can put you in...
You are walking down a narrow alleyway towards a dead end when you realize that several brigands are approaching you from behind with malicious intent. What do you do?

options.text: Make a run for it and avoid them.

nodes.text: I immediately turn around and run towards them at great speed. Before they can get over their astonishment at my audacity, I nimbly dodge around them. I then duck around a corner and hide in the shadows.

options.text: Let them come for me and trust to luck.

nodes.text: I turn around and calmly watch as they approach. Just as they start to threaten me, I give them my biggest smile as the chimney on the building beside them collapses down upon their heads.

options.text: Take them on directly.

nodes.text: I grab a nearby rain barrel and toss it at the brigands. As they try to dodge it, I rip a rainpipe off the nearby wall. I then swing the pipe at my assailants, knocking them to the ground. They cower and beg me for mercy.

options.text: Look for a way to avoid them.

nodes.text: As I nonchalantly walk, I listen carefully. Judging from the solid tromping sound of their feet, I can tell they are both large, muscular, and slow.
I can see an open window on the building ahead of me, barely large enough for me to squeeze through. Without warning, I leap for the window and make my escape.

You have been traveling along a dusty road for hours when you see a tree loaded with bright, ripened apples. As you start to munch on one of the apples, an old woman hobbles out from behind a hedge and shrieks, "How dare you steal my beautiful apples!" What do you do?

options.text: Assume she must be magical.

nodes.text: I use my Magical skill to see that the woman is a powerful Faerie cloaked in illusion.
"My apologies to you, Great One. Shall I make amends by protecting the tree from other intruders?"
With her permission, I cast a powerful spell on the tree to hide it from sight and then go off on my way.
Of course, this assumes that I know how to cast powerful magical spells after going to this school.

options.text: Outwit the woman.

nodes.text: I reply to the old woman, "I was not stealing, good lady. I was merely sampling the flavor of this amazing fruit! You should sell them in town right now. You could charge a gold piece for any one of them."
While the old woman is greedily picking fruit, I go off on my merry way.

options.text: Sweet talk your way out of it.

nodes.text: I bow low before the woman. "My humble apologies, dear lady, please forgive me. I had no idea that this apple belonged to such a charming woman as yourself."
"It was an honor to meet you, and I thank you so much for your hospitality." I bow again and walk off, happily munching on the rest of the apple.

options.text: Stand your ground and intimidate her.

nodes.text: I frown and step towards the woman. "By what right do you claim this apple to be your own? I see no trespassing or habitation signs here. Thus, legally, this land belongs to my Lord, the ruler of this land."
"How dare you claim his goods for your own! I shall report you to the authorities." As she begs forgiveness, I resume my journey.
A fire rages through the town. You see a group of people standing around and pointing upwards at a nearby building. There through the window you see a small child screaming for help. What do you do?

options.text: Climb up the wall and rescue the child.

nodes.text: I swing my rope and grapnel to catch the window frame. Then I shimmy up the rope, grab the child, and rappel down before the building collapses. I have rescued the child and am declared to be the hero of the town.

options.text: Brave the fire and run into the building.

nodes.text: Heedless of the flames, I run into the burning building. I dash up the stairs before they collapse behind me. Then I grab the child and jump out of the window across onto the awning of the adjacent building and drop down to the ground.

options.text: Talk the crowd into helping.

nodes.text: "We've got to save that child!" I shout to the crowd. I grab the burliest man and say, "You're the strongest and bravest of this group. Get down on your hands and knees here next to the building. The child's life depends on you."
Thus, I exhort all the bystanders to form a human pyramid. I then climb to the top of the pyramid and carry the boy to safety.

options.text: Improvise a safety net to rescue the child without getting singed.

nodes.message: When Shawn meets the Kwirk, he doesn't know what a Kwirk is. Maybe this should be rewritten (toy gargoyle? toy dragon? toy minotaur?)

nodes.text: Judging from the smoke and the visible flames, I estimate that the burning building will collapse in ten minutes, so I race down the street looking for a fisherman's net, a flagpole, a can of lard, and a toy crocodile.

When I return, I construct a safety net by stretching the fisherman's net between two merchants' carts. After I secure the stuffed crocodile to the top of the flagpole, and smear the grease along the pole, I raise the crocodile to the window.
As the child grabs the toy, he slips down the greased pole into my safety net.
You have been falsely arrested and imprisoned in the dungeon of a cruel king. You are doomed to be executed in the morning unless you escape. What do you do?

options.text: Talk the guards into taking your side and helping you escape.

nodes.text: I convince the guard captain that hereditary monarchy is inherently immoral. I persuade the guards that the guard captain is far more suited to rule than the spoiled brat they call 'His Majesty'. Then the guards and I overthrow the tyrant on the throne.

options.text: Gamble with the guards and bribe your way out.

nodes.text: I ask my jailors to join me in a game of cards. While I am winning all their money, I carefully take the key ring from the jailor's belt.
After I win a big pot and they go away angry, I use the key to unlock the cell. I then use the money to bribe a servant to sneak me out of the castle.

options.text: Break open the cell door and fight your way out.

nodes.text: I test the bars on my cell and twist the loosest one until it comes off. I then slip through the gap and use the bar to pry open the jail door. As I rush the jail guards, I grab a chair to club them over their heads. I free the other prisoners from their cells and then storm the castle with them.

options.text: Wait for an opening and escape at the last minute.

nodes.text: When the jailor approaches my cell with the last meal, I notice that he is partially blind in one eye. Taking advantage of his bad eyesight, I carefully move my boot into the doorway to prevent the door from properly latching.
I listen until the jailor returns to his office and starts to snore. Then I open the cell door slowly to avoid the squeaking hinges and sneak away.
What do you intend to accomplish from your dedicated studies at this prestigious University for Heroes?

options.text: I want to make friends and influence people
I want to make the world a happier and nicer place for everyone
I want to gain personal power
I want to lead people to a brighter future
I want to find true love
I want to get out of school
I want to entertain others with my wit, talents, and skills
